reviewText:
I discovered Simon Amstell while watching a little British show called Grandma's House.  From there I watched all of the "Simon Seasons" of "Nevermind the Buzzcocks".  My Simon fix was still unfulfilled.  I found this little gem and have watched it three times since I got it a week ago.  Simon is amazingly vulnerable here; yet never losing his razor sharp wit.  I laughed and I cryed.  And then I laughed some more....
This is smart, funny, and at times heartbreaking.  Worth every penny...
